title: National Practice Leader - Credit and Crisis Management
description:
National Practice Leader – Credit and Crisis Management
  
  

This is a hybrid role with the flexibility to work both virtually and from any of our US offices.
  
  

Aon is in the business of better decisions
  
  

At Aon, we shape decisions for the better to protect and enrich the lives of people around the world.
  
  

As an organization, we are united through trust as one inclusive, diverse team, and we are passionate about helping our colleagues and clients succeed.
  
  

What the day will look like
  
Developing and executing Aon’s broking strategy to include building a coordinated broking organization that drives value to clients and leads the industry with innovation and thought leadership using data & analytics to support the strategy.
  
Responsible for matching client’s risk and capital solutions in a distinctive and differentiated manner; while also driving best in class broking and operating model that modernizes the submission/quote process and the use of data & analytics to build thought leadership and client innovation.
  
Management of carrier relationships in the market to ensure standard compensation and the necessary insights and knowledge for increasing the value from our trading partners.
  
Management of the National Credit and Crisis Management Practice, including the execution of the Broking talent strategy and management to ensure proper reporting, communications, compliance, and collaboration to drive Aon United.
  
Drive the defined operational model (e.g., use of Aon Connect) for effective and efficient management
  
Colleagues
  
Manage Credit Solutions and Crisis Management Leaders, providing guidance and assistance to assure all Leader and Broker responsibilities are performed to appropriately corporate standards.
  
Oversee staffing decisions to promote diverse teams and development opportunities for staff (including career paths and succession planning).
  
Effectively communicate and execute strategies put forth by Leaders of National Broking Leadership.
  
Engage in People Organization related matters pertaining to talent, including goal setting, recruitment, retention, and conflict resolution.
  
Ensure the use of Broker Scorecards to drive accountability and track performance.
  
Carriers
  
Lead National Credit and Crisis Management Market Relationship efforts. Serve as an expert and internal resource on market trends, pricing practices, risk transfer and risk control products, insurance carrier appetites/capabilities/practices and other underwriting developments.
  
Maintain and/or build relationships with carrier’s national management and senior product and client segment leadership.
  
Clients
  
Work closely with the U.S. Broking Office Leaders, Account Executives, Account Managers, and others in designing solutions and negotiating with insurance carriers to obtain the structures, terms and conditions that best meet client’s exposures and needs.
  
Partner with local RMD’s, RSD’s and AE leaders throughout the country to connect with the Client/Prospect community in local offices and better understand how Aon can assist them.
  
Deliver Aon United (DAU)
  
**Champion DAU initiatives including but not limited to:** Aon Carrier Link, Aon Optimizer, Standardized Commissions adoption.
  
Grow Aon’s National Credit Solutions and Crisis Management Portfolio in the US
  
Support Account Executives and Production teams throughout the country in sales and other campaigns.
  
Serve as a leading voice in the RFP Process for Credit and Crisis Management opportunities.
  
Develop and drive client-centric broking strategies throughout the country which will reduce Aon E&O exposure.
  
Contribute and align with wider Product Specialty teams and initiatives.
  
Skills and experience that will lead to success
  
Minimum 15 years negotiating Credit and/or Crisis Management placements
  
Demonstrable record of being a ‘Highly Engaged Leader’ at Aon or similar organization
  
Growth Oriented individual contributor
  
Solid Carrier Relations in the Credit and/or Crisis Management Market
  
Comfort learning and using new systems and applications
  
Ability to understand, analyze and apply data and analytics
  
Promote innovation
  
Previously handled difficult Client conversations
  
Current insurance license or ability to quickly acquire insurance producer’s license in all applicable states
  
**Education :** Bachelor’s degree in relevant discipline or equivalent years of industry experience.
  
  

How we support our colleagues
  
  

In addition to our comprehensive benefits package, we encourage a diverse workforce. Plus, our agile, inclusive environment allows you to manage your wellbeing and work/life balance, ensuring you can be your best self at Aon. Furthermore, all colleagues enjoy two “Global Wellbeing Days” each year, encouraging you to take time to focus on yourself. We offer a variety of working style solutions, but we also recognize that flexibility goes beyond just the place of work... and we are all for it. We call this Smart Working!
  
  

Our continuous learning culture inspires and equips you to learn, share and grow, helping you achieve your fullest potential. As a result, at Aon, you are more connected, more relevant, and more valued.
  
  

Aon values an innovative, diverse workplace where all colleagues feel empowered to be their authentic selves. Aon is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.
  
  

Aon provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran, marital, domestic partner status, or other legally protected status. People with criminal histories are encouraged to apply.
  
  

We welcome applications from all and provide individuals with disabilities with reasonable adjustments to participate in the job application, interview process and to perform essential job functions once onboard. If you would like to learn more about the reasonable accommodations we provide, email ReasonableAccommodations@Aon.com
  
  

For positions in San Francisco and Los Angeles, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction record in accordance with local Fair Chance ordinances.
  
  

Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.
  
  

The salary range for this position (intended for U.S. applicants) is $310,000 to $330,000 annually. The actual salary will vary based on applicant’s education, experience, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity and alignment with market data. The salary may also be adjusted based on applicant’s geographic location.
  
  

This position is eligible to participate in one of Aon’s annual incentive plans to receive an annual discretionary bonus in addition to base salary. The amount of any bonus varies and is subject to the terms and conditions of the applicable incentive plan.
  
  

Aon offers a comprehensive package of benefits for full-time and regular part-time colleagues, including, but not limited to: a 401(k) savings plan with employer contributions; an employee stock purchase plan; consideration for long-term incentive awards at Aon’s discretion; medical, dental and vision insurance. title: Urgent Care Nurse Practitioner or Physician Assistant
description:
**Nuvance Health,** one of the nation's leading health care providers, has recently partnered with **GoHealth Urgent Care**, an on-demand consumer-centric care company, to operate a network of urgent care centers in the Stamford, CT area!  

  

**This new partnership creates an excellent opportunity for experienced** **Nurse Practitioner/Physician Assistants,** with urgent care or emergency room experience, treating both adult and pediatric patients, to join our team!

* Our Physicians and Advanced Practice Clinicians provide a wide variety of clinical services including treatment of acute episodic conditions such as sore throats, colds, flu-like symptoms, cuts, sprains and minor infections.
* It is essential in our urgent care centers that our Physicians and Advanced Practice Clinicians have excellent assessment skills in order to recognize more serious conditions and direct the patient to the emergency room for advanced care when necessary while going above and beyond to deliver an unparalleled patient experience.

**A career with Nuvance Health-GoHealth Urgent Care offers:**

* Flexible scheduling –average of 12 rotating shifts/month
* Work in our beautiful state-of-the-art centers that are patient-friendly and equipped with imaging, labs and an advanced EMR that is fully integrated with Nuvance Health!
* More autonomy with mentoring and support when you need it.
* Our patient satisfaction scores validate our focus on quality of care.
* Competitive compensation and robust benefits package including *401K, PTO and CME.*
* Pay Range: $83/hour - $104/hour (experience-based range)

**Additionally, we have two Excellent Bonus Program** (for fulltime or part-time)**:**

* **Daily Volume Bonus** paid monthly based on patient visit metrics met per shift *(****to reward those who work at the busier centers****).*
* **Quarterly Bonus** of up to 10% on top of your clinical base salary, based upon patient satisfaction scores, productivity and quality measures.

 **MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Minimum of 1 year of fulltime experience in either an Urgent Care or Emergency Medicine setting as a NP or PA (required).
* Experience treating all ages (pediatric and adult patient populations) required.
* Comfortable with minor procedures (sutures, casts, splints, etc.), and preliminary reads on EKGs and X-rays required.
* Physician Assistants: Master’s degree and NCCPA Certification
* Nurse Practitioners: Master’s degree and appropriate certification required (AANC or AANP)

 **WE ARE COMMITTED TO QUALITY CARE:**  

  

All of our GoHealth Urgent Care locations have been accredited by the Urgent Care Association. The only program of its kind, this accreditation was awarded for GoHealth Urgent Care's excellence in both certification and quality and safety standards. This accomplishment signifies our continued dedication to the patients we serve.

 **GO FORWARD:**


When you join our collaborative teams, you can rest assured that your career growth and satisfaction will be handled with the same care that we put into growing our organization. Our modern facilities and innovations will help elevate the way you practice. And, you’ll have more opportunities to expand your professional experience and utilize your advanced clinical training.

*If you’re a dynamic, flexible, experienced clinician who wants to take your career to the next level, we look forward to speaking with you today!*

 **LET'S CONNECT!**

* **Katherine Brantle**y  

Senior Talent Acquisition Partner  

Katherine.Brantley@GoHealthUC.com

**#INDPR**


All qualified persons are granted an equal opportunity for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation and gender identity or expression, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, genetic information, medical condition, family care leave status, pregnancy or pregnancy-related condition, otherwise qualified disabled or veteran status. The company will comply with all fair employment laws in each of the jurisdictions where we conduct business.


For applicants in California, please review our California Consumer Privacy Statement **here**.

### **About GoHealth Urgent Care**


GoHealth Urgent Care has outstanding career opportunities in Atlanta, the Bay Area, Connecticut, Delaware, Maryland, Michigan, Missouri, New York, North Carolina, Northwest Arkansas, Oklahoma City, Portland/Vancouver, Texas and Virginia. And all of these positions have one thing in common: flexibility to practice and support urgent care medicine the way it was meant to be, without the stress and bureaucracy of hierarchical organizations. With reasonable work hours that don’t emotionally exhaust or burn them out, our team can balance and prioritize their professional and personal lives. Remote positions are also available.

 **MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Minimum of 1 year of fulltime experience in either an Urgent Care or Emergency Medicine setting as a NP or PA (required).
* Experience treating all ages (pediatric and adult patient populations) required.
* Comfortable with minor procedures (sutures, casts, splints, etc.), and preliminary reads on EKGs and X-rays required.
* Physician Assistants: Master’s degree and NCCPA Certification
* Nurse Practitioners: Master’s degree and appropriate certification required (AANC or AANP)

 **WE ARE COMMITTED TO QUALITY CARE:**  

  

All of our GoHealth Urgent Care locations have been accredited by the Urgent Care Association. The only program of its kind, this accreditation was awarded for GoHealth Urgent Care's excellence in both certification and quality and safety standards. This accomplishment signifies our continued dedication to the patients we serve.

 **GO FORWARD:**


When you join our collaborative teams, you can rest assured that your career growth and satisfaction will be handled with the same care that we put into growing our organization. Our modern facilities and innovations will help elevate the way you practice. And, you’ll have more opportunities to expand your professional experience and utilize your advanced clinical training.

*If you’re a dynamic, flexible, experienced clinician who wants to take your career to the next level, we look forward to speaking with you today!*

 **LET'S CONNECT!**

* **Katherine Brantle**y  

Senior Talent Acquisition Partner  

Katherine.Brantley@GoHealthUC.com

  

* **Courtney VanSweden**  

Talent Acquisition Partner  

Courtney.VanSweden@GoHealthUC.com

The company will comply with all fair employment laws in each of the jurisdictions where we conduct business.


For applicants in California, please review our California Consumer Privacy Statement **here**.

### **About GoHealth Urgent Care**


GoHealth Urgent Care has outstanding career opportunities in Atlanta, the Bay Area, Connecticut, Delaware, Maryland, Michigan, Missouri, New York, North Carolina, Northwest Arkansas, Oklahoma City, Portland/Vancouver, Texas and Virginia. And all of these positions have one thing in common: flexibility to practice and support urgent care medicine the way it was meant to be, without the stress and bureaucracy of hierarchical organizations. With reasonable work hours that don’t emotionally exhaust or burn them out, our team can balance and prioritize their professional and personal lives. Remote positions are also available.

title: Computer Audit Technicians P/T Second Shift
description:
Since 2001, PlanITROI has been providing global reverse logistics, IT Asset Disposition, and Asset Recovery Services for OEMs, retailers, enterprises, education, and SMB organizations, committed to preserving the highest levels of environmental responsibility and data security while changing lives with their retired computing devices. PlanITROI leverages the circular economy to do social good, by turning clients' old returned, retired, or idle IT devices; laptops, PCs, smartphones, tablets, etc., into recertified, affordable technology solutions sold directly and through the largest retailers in the world!

**Computer Audit Technician Overview:** PlanITROI seeks highly motivated Computer Audit Technicians to join our Production Department. The Computer Audit Technician will wipe, test, image, and configure computer equipment to the required specifications. Audit technicians will utilize third-party software to diagnose defective units and order the needed parts, if economical to repair. This will include, but not be limited to; Laptops, Notebooks, Desktops, Tablets & Cell Phones, and Apple and Microsoft products. This is an ONSITE position in Denville, New Jersey.

Second Shift 5 pm - 9 PM
Monday -Friday
Rate: $17.00 Hour

**Mission:** Wipe, test, image, and reconfigure IT equipment to specifications.

**Primary Responsibilities:**
* Wipe, test, image, and reconfigure IT equipment to specifications
* Diagnose defective IT Equipment utilizing testing software
* Configure, upgrade and test computer hardware & peripherals
* Work with the Production Team to drive and complete projects
* Record configuration, audits performed, and cosmetic information utilizing the production database
* Assist in setting standards and policies to improve efficiency and reduce cost
* Ensure inventory within the department is moved to the correct locations both physically and in the system
* Help organize and maintain the technical facility
* Other duties may be assigned

**Requirements & Experience:**
* Degree, Certificate, or training in computer audit/QC preferred
* A+ certification is preferred
* Knowledge of computer hardware and software is needed
* Diagnostic and troubleshooting abilities are needed
* BIOS configuration and upgrade utilities are needed
* The ability to configure, maintain, and upgrade PC workstations
* The ability to identify and install PC hardware and peripherals
* The ability to answer computer and software-related questions in technical and non-technical terms
* The ability to understand and carry out instructions explained in various forms (written, oral, or diagram)
* Strong communication skills both written and verbal
* Outstanding attention to detail
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment

**PlanITROI Core Values**
* Driven & Confident
* Think Win/Win Always
* Own IT/Solve IT
* Personal Growth Leads to Professional Growth
* Innovate & Change the World
* Proud to be Part of the PlanITROI Family

*Visit our websites:* *www.NextraTech.com*www.PlanITROI.com, www.BuyRecertified.com, www.DigitalDreamsProject.com
